intro: Uvaria acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed uvaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature. Uvaria acuminata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
